meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Bomb Kills Hamas Official Izzideen al-Sheik Khalil, an official of the militant organization Hamas, was killed when a bomb exploded in his sport utility vehicle in Damascus. Syrian and Hamas officials blamed Israel.

Suspect Killed in Pakistan Amjad Hussain Farooqi, who is accused of being the mastermind of two assassination attempts on Gen. Pervez Musharraf, the president of Pakistan, was killed by law enforcement officials.

Bomb Kills Hamas Official Izzideen al-Sheik Khalil, an official of the militant organization Hamas, was killed when a bomb exploded in his sport utility vehicle in Damascus. Syrian and Hamas officials blamed Israel.

Suspect Killed in Pakistan Amjad Hussain Farooqi, who is accused of being the mastermind of two assassination attempts on Gen. Pervez Musharraf, the president of Pakistan, was killed by law enforcement officials.
Yankees' Brown Is Battered The Red Sox spoiled Kevin Brown's return, some three weeks after he broke a hand hitting a clubhouse wall, as they routed the Yankees, 11-4.

Bit by Bit, City Fights a Resilient X-Rated Industry Almost a decade after Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani proclaimed war on the sex shop business, it is alive and well and, at least in Greenwich Village, growing, as pornography merchants have found a way to dodge nearly every regulation imposed upon them.

The Village, which prides itself on being a national symbol of tolerance, has become an example of how loopholes can undermine a once-celebrated law. And the Bloomberg administration is fighting back by citing sex shops for every imaginable infraction.

CBS News Weighs the Future The recent controversy surrounding Dan Rather has complicated two delicate questions in television news: when will Mr. Rather relinquish the anchor chair of ''The CBS Evening News,'' and to whom?
